name: NH City Hotel

reviews.text: The NH City is a step up in both quality and price from the nearby NH Latino, which I also stayed at (and reviewed on this site). However, both hotels are very good and if either one is not available, the other will suit your needs. We stayed in the new "tower" part of the NH City, which is sleek and modern. The room was very well decorated, with a flatscreen TV, nice bathrobes, great toiletries, and huge windows with great views of the city. The only strange thing was that the bathroom sink was in the actual room, not the bathroom. However, other than being an odd set-up, this wasn't a big deal. The breakfast was very good, as at the NH Latino. I would stay here again. (Tip - If you have the hotel launder clothes for you, tell them to go easy on the fabric softener!)

reviews.text: Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised. They had a sign offering upgrades for modest fees. I inquired about the offer and the person at the front desk offered to upgrade me to a suite at no charge.
reviews.title: This Is No Three Star Hotel

reviews.text: I used the concierge a number of times and their English was excellent. They researched restaurants for me and provided directions.
reviews.title: Enjoying the NY City Buenos Aires

reviews.text: The rooms were modern, clean and well appointed. While there is no wireless internet, high speed wired connections are available. Both the bedroom and living room had flat screen TVs. The bed was comfortable and wake-up calls prompt. Note that the bathroom really isn't a separate room per se, but more of an adjacent space.
reviews.title: Lovely Rooms

likes.disliked: — front desk service - no dedicated concierge

reviews.title: Loved NH City But Choose Your Room
reviews.text: The room is very nice and clean. I stayed in a large room, with a living room and a bedroom, closet and the bathroom. The furniture are not modern, but are comfortable.

description: The NH City Hotel is in the heart of the city's tourist, shopping and financial area. The hotel is conveniently located close to the Manzanas de las Luces and the city's landmark buildings: the Government House, City Hall, the Cathedral and Plaza de Mayo and with easy access to the shopping and leisure Puerto Madero complex and the traditional San Telmo district.
